summary:
Wolves, also known as gray wolves, are large wild dogs found in Eurasia and North America. They have various colors, from white to gray and black. Wolves are social and hunt in packs, mainly targeting large animals. They are the largest in the dog family and have unique features like less pointed ears and a long tail.

Wolves travel in families and are territorial. They can have hybrids with coyotes and jackals. Despite fears, wolf attacks on humans are rare. The global wolf population is around 300,000 and is not considered endangered.
title: Wolf
